meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ignominious.
meanings.sent1: The ignominiousness of his actions was evident to all.
meanings.sent2: The team's defeat brought a sense of ignominiousness.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he couldn't escape the ignominiousness of his defeat.
meanings.sent4: The ignominiousness of the situation weighed heavily on her conscience.
meanings.sent5: The ignominiousness of the loss lingered in the air long after the game ended.

meanings.definition: A state of dishonor or disgrace.
meanings.sent1: The soldier faced the ignominiousness of being stripped of his rank.
meanings.sent2: The scandal brought great ignominiousness to the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ignominiousness at being caught stealing a treat was comical.
meanings.sent4: The ignominiousness of his actions painted a dark shadow over his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The ignominiousness of the situation was palpable in the room.

meanings.definition: A feeling of shame or humiliation.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't bear the ignominiousness of her mistake.
meanings.sent2: His face flushed with ignominiousness as he realized his error.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ignominiousness at being scolded for chewing shoes was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The ignominiousness of the situation made her want to hide from the world.
meanings.sent5: The ignominiousness of the rejection stung deeply.
